solution_line_template: There are {coins_hour1} coins during the first hour. {coins_hour2} coins are added during the second and third hours and {coins_hour4} coins are added during the fourth hour. By the fourth hour there are {coins_hour1}+{coins_hour2}+{coins_hour3}+{coins_hour4} =<<{coins_hour1}+{coins_hour2}+{coins_hour3}+{coins_hour4}={coins_after_fourth_hour}>>{coins_after_fourth_hour} coins

The number of coins after giving {coins_taken_out} to her mother is {coins_after_fourth_hour}-{coins_taken_out}=<<{coins_after_fourth_hour}-{coins_taken_out}={coins_left_after_fifth_hour}>>{coins_left_after_fifth_hour}
